title: A Complete Guide to Updating Android Apps from Google Play Store

steps.title: Open the Google Play Store app .
steps.content: Open the Google Play Store app . Tap the app icon that looks like a Play icon in red, yellow, green, and blue colors. Do this if you want to update your apps manually. This works if your apps aren't updating automatically.

steps.title: Tap your profile image.
steps.content: Tap your profile image. It's in the upper-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Manage apps & device.
steps.content: Tap Manage apps & device . It's under the "Play Points" section.

steps.title: Tap Update all.
steps.content: Tap Update all . It's under the "Updates Available" header next to a 2x2 grid icon. This will say "All apps up to date" if there are no updates available. Tap See details if you want to see more information about which apps have an update or if you want to update each app individually. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Google Play Store app .
steps.content: Open the Google Play Store app . Tap the app icon that looks like a Play icon in red, yellow, green, and blue colors.

steps.title: Tap your profile image.
steps.content: Tap your profile image. It's in the upper-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings. It's near the bottom of the menu next to an icon of a gear.

steps.title: Tap Network Preferences.
steps.content: Tap Network Preferences . It's the second option on the menu and tapping it will expand the menu.

steps.title: Tap Auto-update apps.
steps.content: Tap Auto-update apps . Another window with more options will appear.

steps.title: Select how to update the apps.
steps.content: Select how to update the apps. Tap to choose an option and it will fill to indicate that it is selected. Tap Over any network to automatically update using your mobile data connection, which could incur data charges from your mobile carrier. Tap Over Wi-Fi only to allow automatic updates only when your device is connected to a Wi-Fi network. To stop automatic app updates altogether, tap Don't auto-update apps .

steps.title: Tap OK.
steps.content: Tap OK . This saves and applies your changes as the window closes. [2] X Research source
